intro: Erigeron radiosus, commonly known as the rayless fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces small, white to pale yellow ray flowers surrounding a central disc of tubular florets. Erigeron radiosus is often found in dry, sandy or gravelly areas and is adapted to thrive in various soil types.
